bibl.title: Priests and State in the Roman World

bibl.seg: Capponi Livia, Priests in Augustan Egypt.
James H. Richardson and Federico Santangelo (Edd.), Priests and State in the Roman World = Potsdamer Altertumswissenschaftliche Beiträge. 33 (Stuttgart, 2011) pp. 507-528.

Challenges the consensus that the Roman conquest of Egypt marked the beginning of the decline of the temples as the priests lost most of their privileges. Using papyrological evidence, shows that priests continued to farm their land and paid taxes on it.
